title: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: When using JDK 1.4, the 'All types' dialog shows obfuscated classes with names like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc. These classes are less readable and make it difficult to identify the desired classes.
OB: The 'All types' dialog displays obfuscated classes with unreadable names.
EB: The obfuscated classes should be less prominent in the 'All types' dialog, making it easier to identify the desired classes.
SR: To reproduce the issue, open the 'All types' dialog in JDK 1.4 and observe how the obfuscated classes are displayed with their unintelligible names.
